channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report X-2024030884
item.description:
Report X-2024030884

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat Spill. Undeclared hazmat: no hazmat markings or paperwork present on outer packaging (Spidr checked). No overpack label. Leaking fiberboard box found in sealed (with zip-tie) bag within tote on HMPA staging pallet. Prior events unknown; the OP-951 was not filled out at the instance of discovery on the dock. DescribePack: Content: One 5 gallon metal drum with a removable head (1A2) lost 15oz of fluid from deterioration of the o-ring or seal fitted around the fill hole and inlaid cap/plug in the lid of the drum. Although the cap/plug inlaid in the drum lid was intact, tipping drum to the side allowed leakage from just under the cap/plug. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation used.

item.title: Report E-2024030392
item.description:
Report E-2024030392

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 13, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN2582 had a loose cap in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and sodium bicarbonate to remediate the UN2582-impacted tote. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket and staged on site for transport and disposal.

The rest of the cans were soiled in the paint as well as a small box with the Ltd Qty symbol that was inside the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 3/19/2024, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 2300567 at the station location in Colorado Springs, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing 3 1-quart plastic bottles labeled "Silver Nitrate". The shipment is discovered damaged from spillage from one of the bottles. The package was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, as it does not have to required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and is being held pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2024030393
item.description:
Report E-2024030393

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 13, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1903 was damaged by falling freight and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN1903-impacted trailer and concrete. All impacted material was collected and containerized into three (3) 35-gallon drums and the patched tote was placed on a spill pallet. All waste was staged in the R+L heat room for transport and disposal. The crew returned the next day to perform a tote transfer. TLE personnel transferred the product from the damaged 330-gallon tote into a new 375-gallon tote to be shipped off to its destination. The generated waste from the transfer was collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum. All waste and the damaged tote was staged in the R+L heat room for transport and disposal.

DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Wearing the proper PPE I was able to pour the escaped amount in box into hazmat drum along with the plastic bucket containing spilling contents.

  • City: EDINBURG

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from trailer 828118 that was sent from 774-HOUS-A at 0653. At approximately 0730 package was unloaded from a tugger cart and placed on portable belt at front of belt 1. Belt 1 manager noticed that the item appeared to have some of its contents spill out from its base and called QA to the belt to inspect the package. Upon inspection it was found that the inner item had a damaged base that allowed its contents to spill out. Item was placed in a yellow salvage drum and secured at QA1 to be processed post sort. DescribePack: inner item (plastic pale) cracked at the seam of its base, approximately 7 inches around. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as the item was confirmed to be damaged it was removed from the belt and placed in a salvage drum then secured at QA1 to minimize the potential for items or personnel being harmed by its contents.

item.title: Report E-2024030373
item.description:
Report E-2024030373

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: LANTAU
  • State:
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT 14:05 LOCAL TIME IN HONG KONG, AIR PACKAGE 1Z8Y202X0464721146 HAD PASSED X-RAY SCAN WHEN A LOADER OBSERVED THE PACKAGE SMOLDERING ON THE BELT. THIS OCCURRED PRIOR TO LOADING INTO AN AIR CONTAINER. A RESPONDER SEGREGATED AND INSPECTED CONTENTS TO FIND A THERMAL EVENT OCCURRING WITH THIRTEEN OF THE LITHIUM ION BATTERIES INSIDE THE PACKAGE. AT 14:17 LOCAL TIME AIR PACKAGE 1Z8Y202X0466413289 WHICH WAS TRAVELING UNDER THE SAME MULTI-PIECE SHIPMENT WAS FOUND SMOLDERING AFTER HAVING ALREADY BEEN LOADED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER. PACKAGE CONTENTS WERE INSPECTED TO FIND EIGHT LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CHARRED INSIDE THE PACKAGE. LITHIUM ION BATTERIES IN BOTH PACKAGES INVOLVED IN THE THERMAL EVENT WERE ISOLATED. INSPECTION OF THE BATTERIES DO NOT INDICATE THE WATT HOURS. THE THERMAL EVENTS THAT OCCURRED INSIDE BOTH PACKAGES WERE ISOLATED TO THE LITHIUM ION BATTERIES ALONE. THERE IS NO EVIDENCE OF CHARRING ON THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOXES. THE PACKAGES WERE PART OF A 77 MULTI-PIECE SHIPMENT SCHEDULED TO TRAVEL FROM HONG KONG TO THE USA. THE PACKAGES HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT. THE SHIPMENT WAS PREPARED IN ACCORDANCE WITH IATA PI 965 SECTION IA WITH A SHIPPERS DECLARATION, CAO LABELS, CLASS 9 LITHIUM BATTERY LABELS, MARKINGS AND OUTER UN SPECIFICATION PACKAGING. PER 49CFR 171.15, THE INCIDENT WAS REPORTED TO THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER UNDER REPORT 1393931.

  • City: BATON ROUGE

  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The commodity being shipped are Duracell dry cell batteries. While the shipment is classified as "nonhazard", the shipment began to emit dangerous evolution of heat, triggering an NRC notifciation. On 3/15/2024 at approximately 2200, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5013755 at the station location in Baton Rouge, reporting a package with a dangerous evolution of heat. The shipment consisted of 12 ‘D’ cell batteries which, after further inspection, appeared to be swollen. During delivery, the driver discovered the package was warm to the touch and returned it to the station. This incident has been to be NRC under Report # 1393991 was generated by Ms. Rawls. Due to the reporting requirements to the NRC, this shipment is also being reported to the FAA and is being held for further disposition instructions.

  • Description: On March 12, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of adhesive were punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. The crew then containerized the damaged pails in one (!) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: On 3/14/2024 at approximately 2158, Dangerous Goods Administation received a call from Employee 240946 at a station location in Spokane, reporting an undeclared deisel spill. The shipment consists of what appears to be a diesel fuel pump containing fuel residue. The shipment was discovered leaking during sort. The package was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, being void of the required markings, labeling, packaging, and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

  • City: TUCKER
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 11, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN2054 were damaged during transit due to lack of dunnage and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN2054 impacted trailer floor and neutralized the product on the pallet. FCE deconstructed the pallet and restacked the remaining intact freight for further transport. All spent absorbents and neutralized debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal open-top drum for further handling. The two (2) damaged metal pails were placed into one (1) 55-gallon metal open top drum for disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4in-by-4in area of the trailer floor and cardboard packaging and estimated that two (2) ounces of material was released due to a weld failure on one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Enviroserve personnel transferred the remaining product into two (2) 275-gallon poly tote and shipped on to the consignee. The released material was scrapped from the trailer floor and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail along with impacted cardboard from the other freight. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XWK experienced a UN3266 Flash Clene 1414 release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 cups of product released to 1' x 1' area on the trailer floor and a 1' x 4' area on the trailer wall due to a cracked tote corner. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The impacted areas were then neutralized and cleaned with soda ash and absorbent pads. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 5ft-by-5ft area of the terminal concrete floor and estimated that one-hundred and thirty (130) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel transferred the remaining product from the damaged tote along with rinse water that was used to neutralize two (2) 85-gallon metal drums that Dayton terminal personnel used to collect the leaking product in prior to the contractor’s arrival. The rinse water was offloaded into one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted flooring and collected the spent absorbents and containerized it along with impacted debris into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

DURING THE RESPONSE, RESPONDER DISCOVERED A FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT TO BE CONTAMINATED BY THE LEAKING PACKAGE. UPON BRINGING THE LEAKING PACKAGE, CONTAMINATED DEBRIS, AND SOILED PACKAGES BACK TO THE DMP CAGE, THE HAZMAT'S INNER CONTAINERS HAD BEEN DISCOVERED TO BE SOILED BY THE LEAKER, AS WELL AS THE OUTER PACKAGING, AND NEEDED TO BE PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.description:
Report X-2024030644

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: EMPLOYEE CAME IN THE TRAILER TO LOAD PACKAGES AND SAW DISTRESSED HAZMAT PACKAGE ON TRAILER FLOOR IN UPRIGHT POSITION. HE LEFT NOTIFYING HIS SUPERVISOR. CAME TO RESPOND. SHE HAD HER PPE ON. SHE NOTIFIED THE SUPERVISOR THAT IT WAS A LEAKING HAZMAT AND VERBALLY THE AREA WAS CORDONED OFF. SHE FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET ADDING SILVERSHIELD LINERS UNDER HER NITRILE GLOVES. SHE CONTAINERIZED THE BOX IN SPILL TUB. SHE PH TESTED THE FLOOR AS THERE WERE MULTIPLE STAINS ON FLOOR. THE PH WAS 9. SHE USED WATER AND A PAPER TOWEL TO NEUTRALIZE PH TO 7. SHE WIPED AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE. BECAUSE OF LENGTH OF STAINS, SHE CHECKED THE ROLLERS AND PACKAGES. ALL ROLLERS AND PACKAGES WERE CLEAN. DUE TO DAMPNESS AND TIME, SHE OBTAINED A CORRUGATED PIECE OF CARDBOARD TO COVER ENTIRE ALL STAINS ON THE FLOOR. SHE BROUGHT THE PACKAGE TO THE PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER AND FOLLOWED PROPER DMP PROCEDURE AND DISPOSITION OF PACKAGE.

  • City: DALLAS

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN1760 Nalco 5177 release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the tote lid due to a fault cap. The cap was replaced with a new one and the tote body was wiped down and secured for shipment on. All impacted absorbent pads and PPE were placed into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: Centreville

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024030136: Tank car releasing vapor from both vapor valves and liquid valve. All three valves in open position and plugs less than tool tight. Valves were closed and plugs tightened. X-2024030139: Liquid valve and A end vapor valve found with vapor release. Both valves in open position with plugs less than tool tight. Liquid valve plug had insufficient tape to properly secure plug. Both valves were closed. Liquid valve plug re-taped then both plugs tightened properly. X-2024030140: Liquid valve found releasing vapor past the plug. Valve in open position, plug had insufficient tape to secure and plug less than tool tight. Valve was closed, plug re-taped then plug tightened. X-2024030141: Odor of leaking car from ground. Inspection found liquid valve and A end vapor valves in open position with plugs less than tool tight. Both valves were closed and plugs tightened.

  • Description: Driver was at another delivery making a delivery when he noticed a shipment of pails on his truck slightly leaning. In a proactive measure, the driver decided to take the shipment off the truck at the current customer he was at to restack and stretch wrap it before something bad happened. When taking the shipment off of his trailer when he was crossing the dockplate with the shipment three pails fell off of the pallet contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was contained and confined and an outside response company was called in to help cleanup and remediate.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found with a red stain all over and a leakage and placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage. Once it was acknowledged that the contents inside were aerosols, the tote was transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: The majority of the package was covered in red spray paint. One of the cans inside had a puncture like damage at the bottom, most likely caused by added pressure, which resulted in a leakage. There were smaller boxes inside that contained the Ltd Qty symbol. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

item.title: Report E-2024030254
item.description:
Report E-2024030254

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-19T15:11:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the 150-gallon poly tote and the contractor was unable to determine the volume of material released due to a forklift puncture of one (1) 150-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel stated that they believed that some of the released material evaporated. Hepaco personnel transferred the remaining material into a new poly tote and generated one (1) 55-gallon poly drum containing the cut-up poly tote, impacted absorbents and PPE. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024030251
item.description:
Report E-2024030251

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: WATERLOO
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Environmental Works was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 40ft-by-20ft area of the concrete terminal floor and estimated that one hundred and fifty (150) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) poly tote. Environmental Works personnel deployed a neutralizer and then a granular absorbent to the impacted area. The remaining material was transferred to a new poly tote. The spent material was recovered and placed into three (3) 30-gallon poly drums, one (1) 55-gallon metal drum and one (1) 55-gallon poly drum along with the cut-up damaged poly tote. Environmental Works personnel then pressure washed the impacted area and collected the impacted water and containerized the recovered material into one (1) 330-gallon poly tote. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the concrete terminal floor and estimated that one (1) quart of material was released due to a lose valve on one (1) 330-gallon metal tote. Hepaco personnel stated that the released material evaporated, and the contractor could not confirm the size of the impacted area and examined the ball valve and determined that there was no damage, just not properly tightened. The ball valve was tightened, and the cargo was shipped on to the consignee. No waste was generated from this response.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UAD experienced a UN1823 Caustic Soda Micropearls release from (2) 50-pound paper bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 8-ounces of material released to a 7’ x 6’ area of the wooden trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged bags were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The recovered product, impacted shrink wrap, cardboard, and PPE were collected and containerized into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: EDINBURGH

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 6, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of corrosive liquid was damaged by a faulty skid and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the impacted site. ISR personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 95-gallon overpack that was labeled as salvaged material for further handling by R+L. Crews swept in soda ash, then collected the neutralized product with hand tools. ISR personnel wiped down the dock floor with absorbent pads and cleaners. One (1) 55-gallon drum of neutralized product, PPE, and any cleanup debris was staged onsite for disposal.

  • Description: On March 6, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3082 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior, pallets, nearby freight and loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel overpacked the damaged 55-gallon drum in one (1) 85-gallon drum. The crew then deployed absorbents to the release and worked them in with hand tools. All impacted absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both drums were staged onsite for disposal.

  • Description: THE LEAKING CLASS 3 HAZMAT WAS RESPONDED TO BY RESPONDER, ACROSS FROM DOOR 19 IN WEST PRIMARY. THE PACKAGE WAS RETURNED TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING. ONE OF THE FOUR 1-GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES (TECHSPRAY ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL) INSIDE THE PACKAGE HAD LEAKED DUE TO A LOOSE LID, DAMAGING ONE OTHER BOTTLE IN THE PROCESS. PACKAGE IS BEING PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP, AND ALL NON-DAMAGED MERCHANDISE WILL BE RETURNED TO THE SHIPPER VIA A SALVAGE DRUM.

  • Description: A STEEL DRUM AIR PACKAGE FROM USA TO CANADA WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY. THE PACKAGE WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1866, RESIN SOLUTION WITH A CLASS 3 DIAMOND LABEL AND SHIPPERS DECLARATION. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE STEEL DRUM, THE SIDE IS DENTED AND THE HANDLE IS PUNCTURED CAUSING PRODUCT LEAKING FROM THE PUNCTURED HANDLE.

item.title: Report E-2024030269
item.description:
Report E-2024030269

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 7, 2024, one (1) defective 275-gallon tote of UN1760 leaked approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior during transit. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the release and worked them in with hand tools. A forklift was utilized to perform a gravity transfer of the remaining product from the damaged 275-gallon tote into one (1) new 275-gallon tote. Additional granular absorbents were deployed to the trailer floor to remove any remaining material and worked in with hand tools. All UN1760-impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-11
  • City: LAKE PARK
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver 18151 was dispatched for a load going to Lake Park Mobil but was given a customer information sheet for Northlake Mobil. Driver did not catch this mistake and went to the wrong location. Once he arrived, he obtained an ATG reading that verified his load would not fit. The driver overfilled the tank and this resulted in a spill that impacted a drain. After investigating this with the APEC rep it was determined that the Reg tank was able to hold an additional 200 gallons of regular. Because the tanks are manifolded the rest of the product flowed into the premium tank. Only approximately 12 gallons of product was actually spilled. CDG managed the response and cleanup.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RSR Crew was inspecting a set of cars in Silver Springs Siding that NS had set out. Crew noticed car #UTLX 209221 leaking diesel fuel and immediately notified RSR Trainmaster, Matthew Quattrone and Director Environmental Rita Mager. Car UTLX 209221 was set out by NS about 12 hours before RSR crew got there and were not sure how long it had been leaking. It was a slow leak - about 1 drop every 12 to 15 seconds. RSR Crew contained the spill. Rita Mager contacted SPSI who responded to site for repairs to car. Per SPSI, repairs noted as 'Tightened the packing nut of the valve stem packing to stop the leak." Report sent to car owner, who issued the OTMA.

item.title: Report X-2024021644
item.description:
Report X-2024021644

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-02
  • City: DULUTH
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Wisconsin Central Railroad Ltd.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CN Transportation employee observed liquid coming from the top of tank car TILX 726166 while performing switching operations at the CN Proctor yard, Duluth, MN. The employee notified the employee in charge who then notified the CN Dangerous Goods Team and CN Environment to investigate. A CN emergency response contractor was dispatched to the location and found (2) of the (6) manway cover swing bolts to be loose (could turn by hand) preventing a proper seal of the gasket allowing the contents to leak out when the car moved. Both the liquid and vapor line vale securement plugs were found tool tight. The shipper security seals were found to be intact at the time of inspection. The security seals were removed from the manway cover and the protective housing cover. The manway cover was opened to inspect the gasket which was found to be in good condition. The manway cover was closed, and all swing bolts were properly tightened. The valve securement plugs were inspected and found tool tight. New security seals were applied. The exterior of the tank car was cleaned off utilizing a degreaser and rags.

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On2/9/2024 at approximately 1730, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4009660 at the station location in Jamaica, NY, reporting a corrosive spill. The shipment consists of 3 fiberboard boxes, each marked as "Excepted Quaniities" and each containing a cylinder. One of the boxes leaked during transport. Further inspection revealed that the closure appeared bent, resulting in spillage. Upon obtaining the UN classification of the Hazard class 8 substance from the shipper, it was determined that the commodity may have exceeded the maximum allowable amount for excepted quantities, according to IATA Regulations. An estimated 4000 mL of liquid was discovered in each cylinder. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

  • City: HAMPTON

  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/6/2024 at approximately 1830, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4346935 is the station location in Hampton, reporting an undeclared dangerous goods shipment. The package consisted of one fiberboard box, containing an inner fiberboard box with a glass bottle inside. The attached paperwork identifies the commodity as "Hydrogen Sulfide", prompting the opening of the shipment for verification. The package was not prepared with the required DG markings, labeling, or paperwork, in accordance with IATA regulations and is being held, pending an FAA investigation. UPDATE: Further review revealed a misclassification of the commodity. The commodity appears to be identified as "fuel oil" and as requesting that test be conducted using "hydrogen sulfide". The spill incident is being resubmitted with the updated classification.

To clean up the spill, sand was put down to absorb the spill while the box was recovered and put into a salvage drum. DescribePack: The clips on the lid became undone on the side it dropped on DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Sand was used to absorb the spill and the box was retained in a salvage drum

  • Description: On 2/8/2024 at approximately 1930, Dangerous Goods Addministration received a call from Employee 3646681 at the hub facility in Miami, reporting condensation developing on the outside of a package. The shipment consisted of two cans classified as "paint" (according to the marking) packaged in dry ice. During inspection, the shipment built up frost on the outer packaging. Further investigation revealed that the package polystyrene lining was damaged, resulting in the condesation buildup. Additionally, one of the cans spilled due to an apparent damaged closure. The outer package does not appear to have UN Specification marking. The shipment has been rejected and is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2024030242
item.description:
Report E-2024030242

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-2ft area of the terminal floor and estimated that half a gallon of material was released due to damage to the 330-gallon metal tote. Hepaco personnel stated that granular absorbents were deployed prior to their arrival by ESTES terminal personnel and Hepaco deployed additional granular absorbents along with chemical boom. No waste was generated from this response. A 330-gallon metal tote was ordered and Hepaco returned to the site to transfer the remaining from the damaged tote. The impacted absorbents were recovered and containerized into one 15-gallon metal drum along with the spent PPE. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling northbound on Route 8 and was attempting to take the ramp onto I 271 North. For unknown reasons, the KAG Energy, LLC driver lost control of the unit and and went off the overpass. The tractor and trailer were immediately engulfed in fire. 7497 gallons of diesel fuel being hauled on the trailer was lost. A nearby creek was impacted by the spilled diesel fuel. Hepaco Environmental and Atlas Environmental were dispatched to the scene and continue to remediate the release.

item.title: Report X-2024030225
item.description:
Report X-2024030225

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T00:34:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-23
  • City: TROUTDALE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was discovered in trailer during unloading. Package was actively leaking, no noted damage to outer packaging. upon inspection of package, I found one, one pint of paint related material was leaking due to cap failure, The other 11 cans were soiled and dented. There was a second package inside with the HAZMAT, a limited quantity that was undeclared, it was not damaged. Outer packaging for bother inner boxes, could have fit at least 6 of the same size inner boxes. There was a little air bags inside, but not enough to keep inner packages from moving around. The cap failure caused about 1\2 of one pint to leak out. Leaking container was removed and turned right side up to stop leaking. DescribePack: cap failed to seal properly causing contents to leak. Posible caused by insufficient inner packing. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The leaking can was removed from box and sat upright to stop leaking, all items were placed in a black plastic bin with a bag.
